vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐπίορκ-ος, ον,
sworn falsely, of oaths, εἰ δέ τι τῶνδ᾽ ἐπίορκον 8th c.BC: Ilias Homerus Epicus “Illiad” 19.264: frequently in the phrase ἐπίορκον ὀμόσσαι take a false oath, swear falsely, [Refs]; in full, ἐπίορκον ὅρκον ὤμοσε [Refs] he swore a bootless oath, i.e. one which he meant to fulfil, but the gods willed otherwise.
__II. of persons, forsworn, perjured, [Refs]: superlative -ότατος 5th c.BC: Antipho Orator 6.48. adverb -κως 2nd c.AD: Herodianus Grammaticus 6.9.2.
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
perjured; as a noun, perjurer
one who violates his oath, perjured, 1Tim. 1:10*
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: kẻ thề dối; khai man. ἐπί (G1909) + ὅρκος (G3727)
